name: Dungeon Siege
description: Dungeon Siege® combines the immersive elements of a role-playing game with over-the-top intensity and non-stop action. Dungeon Siege plunges you into a continuous 3D fantasy world where you face off against an army of evil that has been unleashed.
minimum_requirements: Minimum  OS: Microsoft® Windows® XP SP1 or newer Processor: 333 MHz or faster processor Memory: 128 MB of system RAM Graphics: 8MB video card Hard Drive: 1.5 GB available hard disk space Note on Windows 7: Driver version 270.51 or greater is required for Nvidia-based graphics cards. AMD graphics card owners may need to run in Windows XP SP2 compatibility mode.

reviews.review_text: Dungeon Siege is a pretty solid Action RPG in the vein of Diablo. Although it requires some coaxing to get functional on a modern OS it has aged remarkably well and mainly only suffers from somewhat wonky controls (which get worse when you've more party members to manage), a rather awkward camera, and some exception crashes; though in my case that last one plagued the bandit cave area so horribly that it effectively ended my campaign, so your mileage may vary.   Graphics:  The graphics are still pretty passable and in some cases still quite beautiful, no complaints aside from character display UI issues in the inventory screen probably caused by playing on a higher resolution than the game was designed for. Throughout the game, a fairly dark, earthy theme is most-often employed.   Sound:  The game features an excellent, genre-appropriate, soundtrack composed by Jeremy Soule ( Morrowind ,  Oblivion ,  Knights of the Old Republic ...) but has some weird sound effects issues wherein an item drop sound may play when no items are dropped. Some basic, often unconvincing, voice acting is employed for important characters.   Story:  A pretty standard fantasy storyline that doesn't really stand out in any way, although it's not unbearable, it is very linear and can get boring pretty quickly, making it hard to play for extended periods of time. Characters are very basic, as seems very common amongst Action RPGs.   This reviewer gives Dungeon Siege: 7/10

Great game. A lot like diablo. Dungeons are not instanced, so there is no loading. Its somewhat limited thought. Magic isn't elemental. Fire monsters take as much damage by fire spells as ice monsters. Its somewhat imbalanced, melee is overpowered. The party system and mules are awesome. I just love being able to control a party of heroes instead of only one, but at the same time not a whole army. It is like playing a truly rpg pen and paper by yourself where you control the whole party, or only one hero if you wish. Its not perfect, limited in a lot of aspects, but overall a very enjoyable game with unique features (afaik).
Classic RPG. All lovers of good old RPG should consider playing this. Graphics are (very) old, yes. AI is weak, yes. Yet, still one of the best games i´ve played. So glad i found this on Steam.

Dungeon Siege was a great hack nslash dungeon crawler RPG when it was released and the mechanics are still solid even today, although the graphics have dated poorly.  The reason I do not recommend is that it is unplayable via steam and does not include the expansion pack Legends of Aranna.  There are a few guides that purport to help you run the game via the steam installation and although I've spent numerous hours following them to the 'T' and reinstalling the game, it still does not work on Windows 8.1. (The hour I've spent 'playing' was logging into the game on multiple occasions to see if it would work)  If possible try and get the original digital discs or make iso's of your original discs and play the game that way not via the steam copy.
Amazing game. Loved it back in the day and i still love it now.

EDITED: While the game initially has multiplayer disabled there is a guide that allows you to access the multiplayer menu in the steam guides. Just follow the instructions by accessing the Network option and having Hamachi. If you want to play single-player in the network you can do that as well as the benefit of multiplayer is you can have more enemies to kill.  I've changed this because of what I have discovered. It makes me happy. However, I still find it ridiculous, and annoying, that they disabled the multiplayer menu where what they should have disabled is their matcmaking and internet options.
Very good game old school remind me of the best times. When I had time to play all day long! Love it!

Graphics Siege - The War Against Windows  This is potentially a great game, however, it doesn't work for many people with later versions of Windows (esp 8.1) and the multiplayer is currently disabled. Added to that is the fact that the game is unsupported outside of the community, and you end up with a real risky purchase. I'd say just look elsewhere until the game is reliably working unless you happen to have an older computer / OS.

One of my favorite classic rpg right beside diablo and bauilder's gate series this here classic rpg gives tons of hours worth of gameplay and story to the famous rpg makers before S-E picked up the title great for those who want to play an classic pc rpg that takes no space an really leaves a wonderful taste of epic adventures in your mouth for life!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Played on windows xp, vista, 7 , and 8!!!!!!

A word of caution: the game crashes right after the end boss is defeated. There are several forum postings on this issue but it doesn't seem that it was ever resolved. You can watch the end on youtube but it's still a bit of a letdown.

My brother played the ♥♥♥♥ out of this game. Watched him all the time. If you want an action packed action/adventure game this is the one for you. I RECOMMEND the ♥♥♥♥ out of this game. 10/10  And people keep saying that the game is unplayable on windows 10, it works perfectly fine.
It is a fantastic game but you may find it hard to make it run properly on new pc's ! It's a very old game but still one of my favourites ! Definitely worth checking out .

An amazing adventure where you control your party, kill and loot. The best feeling is when you finally come to a town and sell all the loot you picked up. this is a must play if you like old school games. the graphics look quite impressive for it's time.

Oh boy, the memories. I still have my copy of Dungeon Siege and Legends of Aranna lying around here somewhere. This game is a classic, and years after I had stopped playing because I had actually overplayed it and worn out my interest in it, it's still fun. Only now, I have all three of them and get to see what's new in the more recent editions.

Now a classic and despite the series and fanfare it spawned remains undeservingly without a true spiritual successor. The reviews I've read from my peers thus far are spot on. This little Tactical-RPG was way ahead of its time. Touted as a 'Diablo killer', clearly inspired by Baldur's Gate the expectations were high (to say the least) upon release.   Admitedly though and to no surprise the fledgling developer (at the time) Gaspowered Games may have bitten off more than it could chew (as the title falls short in many aspects of its predecessors). Still this shouldn't deter you from giving it a go as it is a solid piece of work from start to finish.  Unfortunately however Steam has failed to acquire the Exanpsions which contain necessary patching and multiplayer is relegated to LAN, TCP/IP, Hamachi or GameRanger. All of these options require time and effort to coordinate play with others rather than being able to just jump right in. Still if you like ARPGs give this one a chance.   It should also be noted there were many mods of varying qualities great and small including a couple of conversions such Ultima V & 6 all thanks to the dedicated Dungeon Siege Community -- should you be interested extending the experience.

I adore this game. My first Dungeone siege Game was Dungeon siege II and I can see similar gameplay when I play the first one. First time I played I could see where the second game got their mechanics and while this game has a more simplistic version of the second games levelling system I love it!! My first time playing I found it charming but as I contine to play the charm has turned into respect for the team that made the game and love for the game itself. I might be a little biased to my series as the dungeon sige series was one of my first RPG's but 10/10!!
Classic Dungeon Siege. Looks kinda' ugly now, but still entertains. Too bad the expansion is not available on Steam.

Do you like clicking!? Then this is the game for you! Click to move your party, click to attack stuff, click to fiddle with your inventory and click to select what kind of weapon/spell you're going to click the enemy to death with. Good clicking fun.

Classic RPG by Gas Powered Games and released by Microsoft in 2002. It's easily one of the best RPG series ever made starting with the original Dungeon Siege: Kingdom of Ehb, and it's official expansion Dungeon Siege: Legends of Aranna. The quests are linear with lots of hack-and-slash combat play. It's still one of the best RPG series ever created in my books.
Loved it, wish there was more to it though.

A great, classic game with fair character customization. I haven't played the newer ones, but this one is simply amazing. While the multiplayer is disabled, the singleplayer works just fine. Just remember to save frequently, as dying in this game is merciless, and Windows 7 occasionally crashes the game. Other than that, the choices of being a warrior, ranger or two types of mages, or just mixing it up a bit, because you don't need to specifically pick a class, the game provides hours of entertainment. Before you question it, yes there is a difficulty setting, from easy to hard. And honestly, I'm finding Normal to be pretty difficult as it is.

One of my all time favs from childhood besides Morrowind. I can recommend it to everyone, though I must admit, that there seem to be problems for some Windows 7 / 8 users, but I have seen nothing so far, that couldn't have been overcome just by setting the correct launcg options. This is a must have for everyone who wants to play some old school game

This was a huge game changer for me, I loved Diablo and this was the next step for me...if you haven't played this you are missing out, the graphics aren't great by any stretch but it is hours of fun.
Loved this game when it came out. Created several characters, trying out different combinations, at different rates. Playing online was great fun. Glad to be playing it again.

Amazing game! Diablos cousin dungeon Siege is a long easy-going game that is always fun to play. Has replay value. Your player can be a warrior, archer, nature magic wizard, or combat magic wizard. If you want you can make him/her a balance of all. Along the way you can have other NPC players join your cause.  be sure to hold on to that newbie knife in the begining if you want to go to chicken level :P
I loved this game when I first got it and I still love it now, I wish they also had Legends of Aranna for sale on Steam though.

Lovely game, especially for its time! Lots of hours of fun adventuring and dungeons! Though if you try it, get ready for an anti-climactic ending; the Steam version has no cutscene after defeating the end enemy, oh and no multiplayer. Still worth playing despite these silly short-comings. 4.5/5.0 stars for original CD version. 3.0/5.0 stars for Steam version. Enjoy!

Well, I'm not a big fan of Hack & Slay games in general.  But this one added some elements that made it more interesting for me: Semi-automatic attacks instead of clicking marathons (btw bad for your health), strategic elements like several formations, character behaviour configuration, group separation and finally the ability to freeze the game any time to plan your moves and reorganize your party. And there are easy to confiure hot keys on the fly to get e.g. just your melee fighters together for some special tactics.  But the balancing is a catastrophe. Dungeons are way too long where you can spend hours seeing the same enemies and building blocks again and again. And the AI behaves pretty stupid. They have a very limited field of view and you can easily wake them up one by one or in small groups even when you are surrounded by them in larger halls.  But if you accidentally get into a larger group that hits you a lot: Your health is regenerating very fast. So fast that using health potions is rarily required. And you can find tons of them. Speaking of which there is sooo many loot you can find that it's hard to manage all this stuff and have enough space to get the crap to the next town for sale. Don't let them lie around because they vanish after some time (especially if you change in-/outdoor environments).  At least you can have donkeys in your party that have plenty of storage for all your loot. But then you carry even more stuff around that needs to be organized.   Furthermore the story presentation is boring and you never have the feeling to care about people you meet. They are so dull. And quests are solved when you just did what you should do. That means you don't have to go back to report... it's like magic. This of course leads to a very linear experience. Also the levels are pretty linear. You can only move in restricted areas, you can't fall down and it's hard to die.   Verdict:  There are some good concepts in this game but it isn't executed very well so it gets boring after several hours of playing and finally its only annoying. But playing should be fun and never feel like plain repetitive work, isn't it? Because otherwise you should rather start to work on something useful.
Do not waste any money at all on this game, as it is unplayable on modern machines. Doesnt seem to be supported by steam or Gas Powered Games anymore
From a game of 2002, I did not expect that. It didn't really aged well but some very recent games in the same vein could learn a thing or two from this one.

Completely unplayable, The company that developed it no longer exsists and Square Enix also has nothing helpful for any compatibility problems, any user of windows 8 or higher cannot run this game.  However, i've played this game before and loved it, just wished i could play it again.
I grew up on this game. It always brings back memories when playing it. Its worth a buy.

How to run Dungeon Siege on Windows 7/8/8.1 that will fix flickering and tearing  STAGE 1: Configure your graphic card setting via graphic card control panel 1. Open your graphic card control panel 2. Go to 3D setting 3. Add 'dungeonsiege.exe' 4. Disable or turn off any 3D enhancement 5. Click 'Apply'  STAGE 2: Edit Steam Game Launcher 1. Open Steam 2. Right Click on Dungeon Siege 3. Select Properties 4. Uncheck 'Enable Steam Overlay while in game' 5. Click 'Set Launch Option...' 6. Enter this string  bltonly=true width=1366 height=768  Note: You change the width and height base on your system resolution  7. Click 'Ok' 8. Create desktop shortcut'  STAGE 3: Edit ini file 1. Right click on Dungeon Siege shortcut on desktop 2. Open File Location 3. Run DSVideoConfig.exe 4. Select any graphic card that dont have TnL 5. Click OK 6. Double click on DungeonSiege.ini 7. Select the first line and copy 8. Go to your Document folder 9. Open Dungeon Siege folder 10. Double click on DungeonSiege.ini 11. Select the first line and paste 12. Save  Stage 4: Edit Video Option ingame 1. Run Dungeon Siege 2. Select Options 3. Change Shadow setting to 'None' 4. Select OK  Credit: Stage 1 & 4 = Razali Rambli Stage 2 & 3 = Various source from internet

I remember loving this game when I was a kid and i even still played Dungeon Siege 2 every now and again and was excited to get the origanal on steam. started it up, game is extremly choppy and most the texture fail to load and everything is grey. couldn't even pick up the first fireshot it was running so terribly. Would love it if the released the expansion and a patch or two.

Game keeps crashing... Too many incompatability issues... Despite trying everything I've found on google... Why are you selling games that aren't working Steam? Had it not been for this being in a pack with Dungeon Siege II (Which also has issues, and MULTIPLAYER disabled!) And being in a pack with DS 3 + Expansion... I'd be getting a full REFUND. I'm still thinking about getting a refund to be honest... I feel somewhat ripped off.  Firstly; Why take multiplayer OUT of a game? If it doesn't work, make it work! I'm having to play multiplayer on DS 2 through GameRanger using a NON-Steam version of the game...  Getting rather fed up and frustrated with steam to be honest...  Selling games that don't work -,-' ripping out multiplayer on some of the best games...  Why?

This game has horrible compatibility issues with Windows 8.1   I tried everything I could find to get it to work, it did not.   When it crashes I have to manually shut down my PC by holding the power button down as it refuses to let me get to Task Manager.  Maybe you'll have better luck than me but I don't recommend it.
The best!

Let me start off by saying I really like old school rpg games, but this game is the epitome of boring. The dungeons feel overly long, as if they extended gameplay through the sheer length they make your characters walk. The combat is pretty bland. I went almost all archers with my squad since, at the hardest difficulty, 1: Melee gets decimated and 2: It costs no resources unlike spells. It does fairly well but the gameplay is just blah.  99% of the item drops fall into 2 categories: Items you can't wear and Items you can't use. Either all of the drops have stat requirements that are way beyond what my characters can use or they aren't even close to being an upgrade. It's almost exclusively vendor trash.  Leveling: It's pretty much a use a skill get some auto xp gains system. There is no decision making other than what to use. I chose to focus on a single discipline rather than jack-of-all-trades. That said, since I am ranged, my armor selection is pretty ♥♥♥ since it's based on str and int for useage requirements. The choices are poor even if I DID have the appropriate attributes to wear said equipment.  Quests: I'm sorry, there are quests? Basically it's talk to the 3 npcs you'll encounter per chapter then walk linearly through a massive dungeon crawl, completing the quests. Hardly what I'd call quests. There's not really even a reward for doing them that I can see.  It comes down to this: I am playing this through JUST to beat it and play it, but it's not very fun. I was hoping for a NWN-type game and it comes off as an overly long poor diablo clone with a bigger party and crappier combat. My playthrough on the hardest difficulty is basically, set my party to hold/engage freely/strongest target, have them all ranged, then pull with a single guy into range and have the mobs explode. I move the party about 3 feet then repeat. Ranged is kind of necessary since even melee die in 3-4 hits and you can get swarmed by 5+ if you aren't careful. It's a slow slog through dungeons that seem to never end. Since I bought Dungeon Siege 1, 2, and 3 I am hoping the sequels will be much better.  Do I regret buying this? No, I paid like $2.99 or whatever the super Steam sale was, can't regret that. Do I enjoy this game? Nope.

I was having problems with 'tearing' until I installed this game in Linux/Ubuntu using Wine. Game works pefectly. Windows 8.1, not so much. I've tried all of the remedies listed for installing this game in Win 8.1, to no avail. Yes, I have a Dell Inspriron 15 laptop (5000 series) with the Intel graphics card. I've even updated to the most recent drivers, and the display is still tearing. Thought that I'd give it a try in Ubuntu 14.10 using Wine, and it works. Steam, needs to support this game under the WIndows platform if they want me to recommend this game for purchase, as this game IS NATIVE TO THE WINDOWS PLATFORM! Maybe Linux is the future...

I can't believe that this game has spark a long running franchise. Seriously, before people gave me 'I am too young' or 'This game was good for its time', I actually played good action rpg's like darkstone, nox, and the original diablo and enjoyed them. Dungeon Siege should be forgotten, as it has two major flaws with the game. The Bad: 1. Easy: The game is too due to having regen health, 40 million health potions throwned at you, and the foes you faced being too damn weak. 2. Boring: The game throws several dozens opponents at you on a small map. So every few steps, some might pop out, and you ever kill them or run to attract more of them. But the biggest sin is combat, as melee fighters just auto attack, which leads the game to be walk spot here, sit there as your guys hacks every 200 people on screen. The Good: 1. Presentation: The game has good music (because of Jeremy Soule being the composer), very good gwaphix (for its time, really out of date now), and the game is not buggy. Conclusion: Just shock how this piece of ♥♥♥♥ game is beloved by many people, and how this game made a franchise. At least Dungeon Siege 2 and 3 are actually above average games.

I love this game. Seriously, it's one of my all time favorites but I cannot recommend this to anyone who owns a Windows 8.1 computer and is feeling nostalgic to revisit this beautiful world again because you can't. It's not compatible with Windows 8.1 and I'm pretty upset that Steam didn't put a huge disclaimer in the product description about compatability issues because I just spent real money on a game that doesn't work.   NOT HAPPY

I would have loved to have recomended this game, but sadly it seems it does't run for me. The steam version has no support for windows 10 (or atleast not for me) and doesn't come with legends of aranna expansion pack. The technical issues and lack of expansion is why I'm not recomending it.
I like so much this game, but in steam it crashes. If someone help me I thank you.

Dungeon Siege® combines the immersive elements of a role-playing game with over-the-top intensity and non-stop action. Dungeon Siege plunges you into a continuous 3D fantasy world where you face off against an army of evil that has been unleashed.  You begin as a humble farmer, and as you travel through the world and gain new skills, you can gather a party of up to eight characters to aid you. Dungeon Siege impels the player into one over-the-top battle after the other as the storyline unfolds and a larger plot begins to reveal itself.  A world of adventure where you can explore sprawling landscapes in a seamlessly unfolding story awaits...
Great game, much like Diablo on PSX.  If you can get used to the horrid controls then it's fun.  5/10
Played this as a child, was lit af. But this ♥♥♥♥ dont work fo some reason. Get it together VALVE!
Love this game!

the game doesnt let you play the ending and cuts off the cutscene at the end sucks i played cd version and now the downloaded disappointed about the ending other than that really good story and game for rpg players

This game is some kind of hack an slash where you don't need to attack. You just walkthrough dungeons. When a monster appear in your range, your caracters auto-attack and auto-aims. You just watch, wait and health your caracters. It's a one button press on 'h' for heal all your team instantly. You can collect items that monster drop.... but after few hours I figure out it's totally useless doing that. You just lose time and most items are just bad. Collect gold? Seem useless too. I get bored really fast.
Love this back then and now it still a great game!

I would have loved to play this game if it was compadible with my computer or with my operating system, but like a lot of steam games it was not. Make sure you can run old games if you plan to buy this game.

I had to shudown Steam application in order to get game running properly even on Win XP, thus I had no Play record. But I can tell you I sepnt +50 hours playing this awesome game.  It's really impressive when it comes to the varity and creativity of enemies and creatures and weapons. Very likable game.

BROKEN ON WINDOWS 8! After hours of trying community patches, graphics are still bugged beyond belief rendering gameplay impossible. Would love to play this game, but buyer be warned, must be experienced Decker or cyber wiz to hack this game and make it playable on Windows 8.

Incompatible error messages for this version of windows and way too many exception crashes. I found that deleting and re-downloading took care of that problem. The characters still seem to have a mind of their own sometimes but I can live with that. It's a real treat to be able to play one of my favorite XP games on Windows 7 and a 42' screen. Fantastic.
Great game!
Dungeon Siege is my Game and there's nothing more to say ! :P :P
There is nothing as frustrating as relentlessly trying to get rid of the screen tearing/flickering on this game on Windows 8.1. STEAM! PLEASE! Figure out the solution!

** Revised review   The true meaning of hack n slash, x100.  You and a  million  [not really] other people in your party just bash their weapons (or spam spells) into enemies while gaining loot Diablo style. You explore the vast land, killing every enemy on sight, and just lay hell upon them while spamming the H button. (Drink: Health Potion?)  If you want a game where you just go to town on every sorry enemy that happens to be in your party's vicinity and don't much care for a great story, you've come to the right place! Just don't forget to heal up everyone in your team! You'll regret what you'll see when they die.  ITEM DROP x999   Resurrection Scroll   ITEM PICK UP x999   Recommended.
A classic for me. I have personally spent a large chunk of my life playing this game over my life. Much better then the third in terms of gameplay.
Would be excellent if I could get it to run longer than 10 minutes.

I had to shudown Steam application in order to get game running properly even on Win XP, thus I had no Play record. But I can tell you I sepnt +50 hours playing this awesome game.  It's really impressive when it comes to the varity and creativity of enemies and creatures and weapons. Very likable game.
First RPG I played on my life. I live it because of the good memories. Would recommend.
Sigh, hve problems with the game. Multiplayer is a no go and need to be setup as a 'shell' so players can grind up their chars. The sudden games being dropped needs addressing

Surprisingly entertaining fast-paced-action fun and best of the series.   It's a pretty linear game, following down a path, that takes you through every chapter.   If you can run it, you can enjoy it. If you've got some brandnew Nvidia/AMD graphics then .. look in the forums before you buy it.   It mostly works quite well, but the AI controlling your party gets really confused sometimes if there are too many groups of enemies and then it gets quite frustrating to play, when your party spreads out and most certainly die.   Avoid death at all costs, because even though resurrection is quite easy (if you stand close enough and you are not in combat at the same time), your character drops all items on the ground on death, that totally clutter the screen and each item needs to be picked individually.. Sheesh.   There is no honour in healing. Since there is no exp gain from healing, setting up a companion to be a healer would render it totally useless in time, because it will never gain levels.   You can have six members in your party AND two Pack-mules(!!).. Awesome. Unfortunately the mules can die too, leaving an even bigger mess to clean up, but its quite rare that they do.  Save often.  It's easy to understand why this game spun a sequel and after playing the second installment I understand why it stopped. The third game, which is the first I played, is something completely different.
Pretty much what you’d expect. Your basic meat n’ potatoes third-person RPG.  TL:DR - would spend hours hacking through lizard men again.

love this series however due to my cpu+gpu combo I am unable to play it & dungeon siege 2 because when they were released amd and ati were seperate companies so be forewarned there are some workarounds if you know what you are doing and in my case I am unable to mod but you might be able to
One of my favs I used to play quite often.
The game is good, but... I wish they didn't disable multiplayer. It would be more fun with multiplayer.
Hours of fun for any dungeon crawler fan.
The best video game I have ever played. A masterpiece.
